LAMP-PCR Biosensor for Heavy Metal Detection

Developing accessible environmental monitoring tools for the Gowanus Canal

Project Overview

This research presents a field-deployable biosensor using Loop-Mediated Isothermal Amplification (LAMP-PCR) for detecting heavy metal contamination through microbial genetic markers.

Part 1: Metagenomic Analysis

Identification of conserved genetic regions associated with heavy metal resistance:

  • Target gene: Cobalt-zinc-cadmium resistance protein
  • Sample location: Gowanus Canal Superfund site
  • Method: Shotgun metagenomics sequencing

Part 2: LAMP-PCR Validation

Primer design and testing:

Reverse primer: GCTAGCT...
